result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie L Beahm

records.addlTxt: to Amend Cash bond to Signature bond
Amended from Cash Bond to Signature Bond- All previous conditions remain: No contact with Witness 1, Victim 1 or their residence
Status hearing on November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:04 AM Defendant Stephanie L Beahm appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Stephanie L Beahm.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22CF111 & 22CF115 tracking together:
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaints in both matters & waives the reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties in both cases.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelims in both matters and asks for a status be set.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing in both matters.
bonds continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:17 PM Defendant Stephanie L Beahm appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by phone for Stephanie L Beahm.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviews file.
Atty Gumz states bond modification motion.  Atty Juech believes the bond set is appropriate at this time.
BY THE COURT:  Court denies motion to modify bond.

Motion hearing on September 22, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Emailed to MCJ. MG

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No contact with Witness 1, Victim 1 or their residence

3:19 PM Defendant Stephanie L Beahm appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Gumz makes bail arguments and asks for a $50 cash bond.  Atty Burdon makes additional recommendations.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No contact with Witness 1, Victim 1 or their residence
Initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
